Here is the reworded step: 
Searching for a dependable and straightforward baked chicken recipe? Look no further than this highly-rated recipe for baked chicken breasts. It's adaptable, universally enjoyed, and most notably, very simple to prepare.
Prepare this highly-rated dish using only five ingredients:
You will require four skinless, boneless chicken breast halves for this recipe.
Chicken Breasts: The recipe requires four skinless, boneless chicken breast halves.
Choose four skinless, boneless chicken breast halves for this recipe.
For best flavor, this recipe includes Creole seasoning to elevate the taste with a hint of heat.
Use these ingredients for a wonderful meal:
Prepare this no-fail recipe with only five ingredients:
Rub olive oil over the chicken breasts and season both sides with salt and Creole seasoning.

Place the seasoned chicken breasts on a baking sheet. Bake in a preheated oven for approximately 25 minutes, flipping halfway through, until fully cooked (or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F). Once cooked, transfer the chicken to a serving plate.
Drizzle pan sauce over the baked chicken before serving.

The cooking time will vary depending on the size of the chicken breasts. Smaller breasts cook faster, while larger ones may take longer. With 5-ounce breasts, it usually takes approximately 25 minutes at 350 degrees F. To confirm doneness, the juices should run clear, and a meat thermometer should read at least 165 degrees F when inserted into the thickest part.
We believe that baking chicken breasts at 400 degrees F produces ideal results, as suggested in this recipe.

The possibilities are endless when it comes to selecting side dishes for baked chicken breasts. With its simplicity, almost anything pairs well: from a straightforward side salad to delectable mashed potatoes. Need some ideas to get started? Check out a couple of these enticing recipe compilations:

Here are some ideas for side dishes to pair with your perfectly baked chicken breasts: - Quick and Easy Side Dish Recipes Ready in 15 Minutes - Irresistible Cheesy Potato Side Dishes - Convenient Prep-Ahead Sides for Effortless Weekday Meals
Feel free to check out more side dish recipes in our wide selection of delicious Side Dish Recipes.
Keep any excess cooked chicken in a sealed bag or airtight container in the refrigerator for up to four days.

Storing chicken breasts in the freezer is a good plan for meal preppers (and for prolonging the shelf life of chicken). The method for freezing the chicken breasts varies for cooked versus uncooked chicken breasts.
To maintain the quality of the chicken, store leftover cooked chicken breasts in the refrigerator for up to four days in an airtight container.

You may want to freeze the leftovers to enjoy another day. Once cooled, wrap each chicken breast in a layer of plastic wrap and foil. Freeze the breasts for up to two months, and when ready, thaw in the refrigerator before reheating.

"I prepared this dish a few weeks back and will be cooking it again for dinner tonight," shares joan. "It's quick and tender — and the leftovers are just as delicious! I used a basic spice mix I discovered in one of the reviews, adding a touch more cayenne for my husband, who likes things spicy. Be careful not to overcook; take it out of the oven, cover with foil, and let it rest for around ten minutes. Yum!"

"An oven thermometer is a cook's best tool," emphasizes uwgrad. "Most domestic ovens don't truly get to the temperatures they claim, and once opened for checking on the meat, they lose the ambient heat real fast. So don't worry about constant checking; just follow the recipe along with the temperature and time given."

"This is my favorite recipe for chicken," says bb2cook. "I use it frequently. I modify the seasonings and sometimes use lemon-infused olive oil. Cooking time can differ based on the size of the chicken breast, so monitor the internal temperature regularly. It always turns out juicy, tasty, and effortless."
Corey Williams has made editorial contributions to this recipe.
Collect all the ingredients.
Preheat your oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit (200 degrees Celsius).
Massage the chicken breasts with olive oil and season both sides with salt and Creole seasoning. Then, transfer them onto a broiler pan.
Bake for 25 minutes or until chicken is done.
Plate the cooked chicken.

Add chicken broth to the pan and deglaze it by scraping up any browned bits from the bottom with a wooden spatula. Adjust the broth quantity as needed to maintain the desired consistency, ensuring the sauce remains flavorful without becoming too thin.
Drizzle the pan sauce over the chicken before serving.
Modify the original recipe's instructions by reducing the salt quantity from 1 tablespoon to 1/2 teaspoon, or to taste, based on feedback and reviews.
